image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: For a week, the Tasmanian government has been hinting it was seeking to move away from the planning process underway to assess the contentious Macquarie Point stadium. It's now official.

title.children: Tasmanian government to ditch current planning process for AFL stadium

image.altText: A rectangular cream house with a blue roof on a green hillside at sunset with trampoline, clothesline and trees surrounding.

props.synopsis: In a bid to support self-built low-cost housing, an architect who built his own property for $150,000, has released free plans for others to download and use.Â

title.children: Architect uploads free plan for owner-builders to use

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a brown jacket looks into the camera with a large church out of focus in the background.

props.synopsis: The child sexual abuse royal commission gave victim-survivors of abuse hope that institutions would learn from their past mistakes. But seven years on from its final report, some victim-survivors are feeling let down all over again.

title.children: A 'second wave of institutional betrayal' is hurting abuse survivors

image.altText: A woman wearing blue scrubs has her arm around an older woman wearing a pink cardigan as they walk across a lush green lawn.

props.synopsis: Senior Australians wanting to stay living at home independently for longer have concerns about new, national charges for services such as showering, cleaning and gardening; and how the co-payments will affect them.

title.children: 'Dismal, pathetic, horrific': Older Australians brace to pay more for home care

image.altText: An aerial view of Hobart with a render of the proposed stadium at Macquarie Point

props.synopsis: The government appears more likely to be preparing to fast-track the proposed Macquarie Point stadium through parliament instead of sticking with the Project of State Significance process.

title.children: Urgency creeps in as Tasmanian premier steps up response to stadium report

props.synopsis: University of Tasmania politics professor Richard Eccleston discusses how the federal election may play out in the state.

title.children: 'It'll go down to the wire': The fight to win the marginal seat of Lyons

image.altText: looking for modi podcast

props.synopsis:
Thousands of Tasmanians are struggling to put and keep a roof over their heads.

Winter is around the corner and for many that'll make tough times even tougher.

Tents, cars and vans have become a common site in our towns and cities as the cost of living pushes people to the brink.

What's being done to ease the crisis?

Featuring ABC reporter Georgie Burgess.

title.children: The growing tide of homelessness in Tassie

image.altText: Hope Beach at South Arm in southern Tasmania.

props.synopsis: A 62-year-old Hobart man has died while fishing with his neighbour at South Arm, police say.

title.children: Man drowns while boating with neighbour south of Hobart

image.altText: NSW Police officer Inspector Amy Scott pays tribute marking one year after bondi stabbing attack

props.synopsis: Families of the victims and dignitaries commemorate the April 13 stabbing attack inside Westfield Bondi Junction that claimed six lives.

title.children: Floral tributes, memorial honours Bondi Junction stabbing victims one year on

image.altText: Jesse Hogan takes a mark surrounded by five St Kilda players

props.synopsis: Toby Greene kicks five goals to lead the Giants to a comfortable win over the Saints in Norwood as Port Adelaide and Hawthorn get set to resume hostilities at the Adelaide Oval. Follow live.

title.children: Giants dismantle Saints in style as Hawks and Power prepare for grudge match

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Team news: No late changes for Power or Hawks

image.altText: Kalyn Ponga of the Newcastle Knights looks sad during an NRL game against the Wests Tigers.

props.synopsis: The Tigers consign the Knights to a third straight loss after the Melbourne Storm extend their winning streak to 17 against the Warriors on the back of an explosive first half at a sold-out AAMI Park. Follow live.

image.altText: Bend in dirt road, smoke in the background.

props.synopsis: An out-of-control bushfire in central Victoria has come within 100 metres of private property, but authorities say fire behaviour dropped off on Sunday afternoon.

title.children: Fire crews crews face 'testing' conditions containing bushfire west of Daylesford

image.altText: A woman in a blazer and a pearl necklace

props.synopsis: Independent MP Monique Ryan says she would have to give thought to whether influencer content paid for by politicians should be clearly labelled as such, after fellow "teal" Allegra Spender revealed she had paid for posts.

title.children: Monique Ryan has 'no opinion' on influencers paid to post about politicians

image.altText: happy snowboarders

props.synopsis: International tourists started to arrive en masse in the famous Japanese ski resort of Niseko in the early 2000s. Now the influx has pushed the cost of housing so high it's almost impossible for locals to compete with wealthy foreigners.

title.children: 'It feels unfair': How Aussie skiers created a property crisis in Japan

title.children: Search for swimmer missing off Newcastle Beach suspended

image.altText: Composite image of three people, a woman smiling, a man with blond hair and a woman talking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Politicians are on a mission this election to connect with voters online like never before. It is opening the door for podcasters and social media personalities to have increasing political influence.

title.children: 'Delulu with no solulu': Influencers changing how politicians campaign

image.altText: Wedges of blue cheese piled on a metal counter.

image.altText: Two people in orange uniforms walk along a 1.5-metre high wall covered with tarp and along the bottom sand bags.
